item.title: Report E-2025030014
item.description:
Report E-2025030014

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 18, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide had a damaged valve and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel investigated the tote to ensure it was secure and moved it into a secondary containment area to watch and ensure it would not leak further. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025020317
item.description:
Report E-2025020317

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0824 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XAY. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 released from tote due to shipper not properly securing cap. The release impacted trailer #3115335. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (Safety Googles) Per the SCM Noah Kelley terminal personnel will perform the cleanup, The terminal used a 10-gallon metal drum to containerize the waste.

item.title: Report E-2025020278
item.description:
Report E-2025020278

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-09
  • City: STREETSBORO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight into trailer forklift operator struck the bottom of a drum when picking up a pallet with the forkblade of the forklift puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Punctured drum was laid on its side and repaired with drum putty and the spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report E-2025020306
item.description:
Report E-2025020306

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from an unknow number of 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
